author: Catrina Roallos
title: Call Gov. Brown: Ask Him to Sign SB 178
text:
| print 
Governor Brown is making his final decision right now on SB 178 – the California Electronic Communications Privacy Act (CalECPA). 
With just a few more days until the end of the session, the time for action is NOW. Call Gov. Brown at (916) 445-2841 and ask him to sign SB 178. 
Technology has advanced exponentially. But our privacy laws are still in the digital dark ages. The police have been taking advantage of outdated laws to engage in widespread warrantless digital surveillance. We need a privacy update for the modern digital world! 
SB 178 is a bipartisan bill with broad support from the state’s leading civil rights organizations and technology companies. The state’s major newspapers all support SB 178. An overwhelming majority of Californians - 82% - want to make sure the police get a warrant for digital information. Even state law enforcement has removed opposition from the bill. 
Make sure Governor Brown hears from you today and stands up for privacy, innovation and public safety in the digital age by signing SB 178 – CalECPA. Instructions 
Call the Sacramento office of Gov. Jerry Brown between 9am-5pm. You may get a busy signal or have to hold through many rings. Please keep trying: Sample script Hi, my name is
